nodes.text: Fortune and Glory was a Personal Luxury Yacht 3000 owned by the Weequay pirate Hondo Ohnaka, which bore his symbol during the Clone Wars.

The Fortune and Glory was owned by Hondo Ohnaka, leader of the pirate Ohnaka Gang. The starship bore his symbol during the Clone Wars. Around 20 BBY, Ohnaka used the starship to deliver missile launchers to the Onderon rebels, who were fighting King Sanjay Rash and the Confederacy of Independent Systems. The yacht was later kept in a hidden hangar in a canyon near Hondo Ohnaka's pirate outpost.
The Fortune and Glory first appeared in the Star Wars: The Clone Wars Season Five episode Tipping Points. The ship's concept art was designed by Wayne Lo.
"Fortune and Glory" is a reference to the film Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom, in which Indiana Jones and Short Round say they're after "fortune and glory."
